pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Scheme.isoSpec_Spec`
`+ Scheme.isoSpec_Spec_hom`
`+ Scheme.isoSpec_Spec_inv`
`+ Scheme.toSpecΓ_val_base`
`+ Spec_map_appLE_fromSpec`
`+ fromSpec_app_of_le`
`+ fromSpec_top`
`+ isoSpec`
`+ isoSpec_hom_app_top`
`+ isoSpec_hom_val_base_apply`
`+ isoSpec_inv_app_top`
`+ isoSpec_inv_ι`
`+ primeIdealOf_eq_map_closedPoint`
`+ ΓSpecIso_hom_fromSpec_app`
`- SpecΓIdentity_hom_app_fromSpec`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11303137468/job/31439886322)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11303137468/job/31439886394)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Apart from the build error caused by the change in `Presheaf.germ`, this looks good. Thanks!
Could you please merge master and adapt to the new variable mechanism?
You need to merge master (a minimal conflict caused by my PR, sorry) and I left some comments.
Apart from the build error caused by the change in `Presheaf.germ`, this looks good. Thanks!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Should these be `@[simp]`?
Since you resolved this, did you decide they should not be `simp`?
Oops I forgot about them. Thanks!
Maybe a (`simp`) `lemma isoSpec_inv_ι : hU.isoSpec.inv ≫ U.ι = fromSpec := rfl` is useful?

[AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme.Spec_map](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/Scheme.html#AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme.Spec_map) seems to suggest this:
```suggestion
@[reassoc]
lemma Spec_map_appLE_fromSpec (f : X ⟶ Y) {V : X.Opens} {U : Y.Opens}
```

The general pattern seems to be:
```suggestion
lemma isoSpec_hom_val_base_apply (x : U) :
```
That said, I would be in favor of converting to shortening `val_base_apply` to `apply` everywhere, since this is unambiguous.

```suggestion
  rw [← Scheme.comp_val_base_apply, ← Spec.map_comp,
    (Iso.eq_comp_inv _).mpr (Scheme.Opens.germ_stalkIso_hom _ (V := ⊤) ⟨x, trivial⟩),
    X.presheaf.germ_res_assoc, Spec.map_comp, Scheme.comp_val_base_apply]
```

```suggestion
theorem Scheme.toSpecΓ_val_base (X : Scheme.{u}) (x) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): API for affine opens
